_header: My love and lady whom I most desire
Subjects: roundels; love lyrics; lovers, addresses to beloved
_description:
A roundel, translated from the French of Charles d’Orléans (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 115) — 14 lines

BLHar682.First Lines: My loue and lady whom y most desereMi recomfort my hertis eleccioun…
BLHar682.Last Lines: …sory am thus forto write yow herefforwhi to say hit were me more plesereBi mouth then make this ocupacioun
BLHar682.Note: As written, repeats first words of lines 1-2 at end to indicate going back to first four lines of the roundel.
BLHar682.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 682.
